title: java-full-stack-development
description: Become a highly skilled full-stack developer by mastering both frontend and backend technologies using JavaScript and its ecosystem. This course gives you hands-on experience building modern, scalable web applications.
overview: This program is designed for aspiring developers who want to build interactive and full-fledged web applications using the JavaScript stack. You’ll learn core web technologies, front-end frameworks, backend server handling, and deploying your projects on the web. No prior experience required — we start from scratch and take you to job-ready.
topics: HTML & CSS – Structure and styling of web pages
JavaScript (ES6+) – Logic, interactivity, and browser APIs
Responsive Design – Mobile-first layouts and Flexbox/Grid
React.js Basics – Components, props, hooks, and state management
Git & GitHub – Version control and collaboration workflow
APIs and REST – Consuming and integrating third-party services
Node.js (Intro) – Back-end JavaScript and Express basics
Deployment – Hosting your full-stack app on Netlify or Vercel

title: python-full-stack-development
description: Learn to build powerful web applications from scratch using Python. This course covers everything from frontend structure to backend logic and database operations.
overview: Python is one of the most in-demand languages for modern web development. In this course, you’ll gain hands-on experience building interactive UIs and scalable backend logic using tools like Django or Flask. It’s beginner-friendly yet career-ready.
topics: HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap – Building the UI
Deploying Full Stack Apps using Heroku or Render

title: cloud-computing
description: Master cloud platforms and modern infrastructure design with this hands-on Cloud Computing course. Learn how to build, deploy, and manage applications in the cloud.
overview: Cloud computing powers today's tech. This course equips you with the skills to work on AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, covering deployment, orchestration, cost optimization, and cloud-native tools.
topics: Public vs Private vs Hybrid Cloud
